title: Ive always wondered...
body:
You are not allowed to have a summoner name that is the same name as a champion name. So what happens when a new champion comes out and you happen to have their name as your summoner name?
it must have happened.
Zac for example, is a legitimate name that someone could easily have had.
Twitch
Bard
Jinx
Vladimir
Viktor
etc etc are all very possible names people would choose (especially if your name was actually Vladimir)

what i want to know is how riot deals with this.

are they just like "sorry pal, its my name now! better luck next time buddy!"
or do they offer RP compensation, or give them that champ/skin for free along with a name change, or what?

I'm quite keen to know how they deal with it.

replies.body: Most likely, I'd say it's just a forced name change. I doubt Riot would be compensating people for having their summoner name that's the same as a champion that's not yet been released/announced. If they do, however, they'd have to be doing it based on when the champion is announced (or even earlier, maybe) so people can't just use IP to name change to an announced champ and get free stuff when forced to name change.
But 13.somethingK IP for a name change only to be compensated MAYBE that new champ is not worthwhile, you lose more IP than it is worth.

It depends on the situation. If someone is cheap and doesn't want to spend RP (assuming the champ also came with the skin, or Riot was compensating with RP [or something else worth RP] instead) then it would very much be worthwhile as the player would effectively be getting RP for IP. Even so, a player may simply have no viable use for their IP (which is considerably unlikely at the moment with the addition of level 6-7 mastery and Mystery Champion tokens) and use the name change as an "IP drain".
You can have a skin name ie. Rusty blitzcrank.

I mean, way back when there were reported cases where people with the same name as a champ had that new champ unlocked for them and a free name change. But I dunno if that stuff was ever confirmed by a rioter.

The player keeps the name. Riot doesn't force you to change it. (As far as I'm aware)

Take "Thresh" on NA for instance, or "Lucian" on KR.
